required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long Term Evaluation of Sarilumab in Rheumatoid Arthritis Patients (SARIL-RA-EXTEND)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Uncontrolled Extension Study Evaluating Efficacy and Safety of SAR153191 in Patients With Active Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA)

brief_summary.textblock:
Primary Objective:
Assess the long term safety of sarilumab in patients with rheumatoid arthritis.
Secondary Objective:
Assess the long term efficacy of sarilumab in patients with rheumatoid arthritis.

detailed_description.textblock:
The maximum duration of the study may be up to 523 weeks:
- Up to 1-week of screening, if any
- At least 264 weeks of open label treatment phase and up to 516 weeks as maximum
- 6-week post-treatment follow-up as required per protocol.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: At least 264 weeks or until commercial availability whichever later but no later than 2020

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients who achieve 20% improvement response according to the American College of Rheumatology criteria (ACR20)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At least 264 weeks or until commercial availability whichever later but no later than 2020
At least 264 weeks or until commercial availability whichever later but no later than 2020

arm_group.description: Sarilumab (SAR153191), Disease Modifying Anti-Rheumatic Drug (DMARD) therapy as required in the initial protocol.

intervention.description: Pharmaceutical form: solution Route of administration: subcutaneous

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria :
Patients with Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA) who were previously randomized in the sarilumab RA clinical program: e.g., the EFC11072 study, ACT11575 study, EFC10832 study, SFY13370, or EFC13752 study.
Exclusion criteria:
Patients with any adverse event leading to permanent study drug discontinuation from a prior study.
Patients with an abnormality(ies) or adverse event(s) that per investigator judgment would adversely affect participation of the patient in the study.
The above information is not intended to contain all considerations relevant to a patient's potential participation in a clinical trial.
